text:
hey everyone welcome to Pai's kitchen today 
I'm going to share with you a brownie recipe

but not just any brownies they are roasted banana 
brownies that just sounds so good we own all the

bananas and chocolate go really well together so 
I'm a bit surprised it's not done more often but

this idea came from a local bakery near my place 
that sells a version of roasted banana brownie so

I kind of took that idea and I made it better so 
I'm going to share the recipe with you let's get

started alright let's see you with the banana 
so I've got your bananas that I've cut about

quarter-inch thick and they laid it out on the 
same pan that I'm using for the brownies okay

and you'll see why I'm doing this in a minute and 
I want to make sure I pack them as tightly as I

can and when I choose my banana I want one that 
is right but still got a little green on it so

slightly under ripe I find they hold their shape 
better it's not too sweet and it's not going to

get too mushy once we roast it all right I am 
going to brush this now with some melted butter

and the melted butter will give flavor of course 
but it's also going to prevent them from drying

out when we broil these okay and now I'm going to 
pop these under a broiler i preheated the broiler

really really hot because I want them to Brown as 
quickly as possible without spending too much time

is the longer they spend under the heat the more 
they will dry out here are the caramelized bananas

it smells so good in here right now when I can 
just eat all this and as you can see the broiler

is a little bit uneven that's okay I need to tell 
you one thing though you'll notice that I lined

the tray with parchment paper you're not supposed 
to use parchment under the broiler because the

heat can burn the parchment as you can see in the 
corners here but if I don't use parchment it makes

it harder down the road as you'll see I just want 
to warn you to not make the parchment stick up so

cut it so that it ends right at the bottom here 
because the parts that stick out that'll burn

badly okay so now I'm going to just move this 
onto my plate because I need to use the tray for

my brownies there we go I'm going to line this now 
with another piece of parchment paper but I want

this one to be big so if it's the opposite I want 
the edges to actually hang over because that's how

you're able to lift the brownies out so I'm going 
to just crumple this up it is easier to mold a

piece of crumbled parchment to the corner than 
a smooth one so that's just a little trick I'm

going to brush the bottom with some some of the 
extra melted butter that we had from the bananas

okay there's a tray let's make the brownie so the 
brownie base that we're making is very easy and

it's a recipe that I've been making for at least 
10 years that's how good it is I haven't felt the

need to modify it even in the slightest but it is 
so good so I've got in here some cocoa powder and

some all-purpose flour and I'm just going to sift 
them together because there's always these little

lumps and cocoa powder mini whisk to the rescue 
as always there's that and then I'm going to add

some sugar and some salt of course to balance that 
sweetness brownie recipes always call for a bit of

a terrifying amount of sugar but it's all good and 
then some toasted pecans they really are the best

nut in a brownie recipe the butteriness of the 
pecans work super well with the butteriness of the

brownie itself next I'm going to add my chocolate 
so what I've got here is dark chocolate and I

actually use good quality dark chocolate not the 
baking chocolate because this is the star here so

what I did here was I chopped them into basically 
small dice so once one way once the other way and

you get tiny little chunks sort of like chocolate 
chip size now I'm going to pour this right into

my flour here and I'm not going to stir it okay 
just hang with me here then I'm going to beat my

eggs so I've got some eggs over here and I'm 
going to beat that together with my vanilla

just roughly just so there are no gloopy white 
bits it just makes it easier when you go to mix

everything together so this butter I melted on the 
stove just until it's melted I don't want this to

get any hotter than it needs to as soon as it's 
melted turn the heat off and bring it over okay

so now I'm going to pour this warm butter over my 
chocolate this is sort of like the secret of this

recipes the heat of the butter will melt most of 
the chocolate but it'll leave some chunks still

whole so when you eat your brownies at the 
end you'll have like little pieces of melted

chocolate but it's a bit of a surprise at the same 
time it's awesome my egg goes in right on top and

now you just stir everything together and that's 
it that's your brownies so if your butter was too

hot then it just melts all the chocolate which is 
okay like that's happened to me too and it's fine

I just like it better when some of the bigger 
chunks of chocolate is still unmelted all right

that's it now if you want to skip the bananas 
this right here bake it in the oven delicious

but we're making it even better I'm going to put 
half my brownies into the pan and spread that all

over so now the bananas and this is why I roasted 
the bananas in the same pan i roasted the brownies

because what I'm going to do is I'm going to flip 
that right on top of the brownies and I'm gonna

try to do this as gracefully as I can and and 
the bananas will usually stick to the parchment

enough that it'll allow you to transfer everything 
and I'm always super nervous when I do this but

the parchment is also non thick enough that you 
can peel it off relatively easily see I did this

ones with foil and this was a nightmare trying to 
pry the bananas off the foil there you go isn't

this cool and now the rest of the batter just 
goes on top I always err on the side of putting

less batter on the bottom because if you don't 
have enough for the top then you're in trouble

right then you have exposed bananas and we don't 
want that all right so this is going to bake in

a 375 degree fahrenheit oven for 45 minutes okay 
what you want is for the top to be dry and almost

crackly crusty and love it all right here it is 
I've let this cool completely you don't want to

cut this when it's hot okay because it's very soft 
it's a very gooey brownie so you want to make let

it cool and by the way these have a really nice 
crunchy crust which is my favorite part so let's

cut out a piece and make a habit of cleaning your 
knife between cuts because the stuff that's stuck

to your night that's going to cause your next 
cut to be not as clean and if you lift this up a

little bit it makes it easier to remove that first 
piece oh look at that gooey brownies with bits of

bananas and pecan ah I don't know about you but 
I'm a crust kind of person I love edge pieces

mmm oh my gosh so good I have made this recipe 
this brownie base recipe so many times in my life

and every time I eat it it's I surprise myself how 
good it is because I can't find any other brownie

that does gooey as moist with that crust that 
crunchy crust is almost like a combination of

a cookie with the brownie inside and now that I've 
started adding roasted banana inside it just takes

it to a whole nother level so definitely give 
this a try the recipe will be on hats hi kitchen

calm when you make it send me a photo on Facebook 
Twitter or Instagram and if you have a subscribe

to the show please do so right here and I will see 
you next time for your next delicious and integer
